page.title: 01Location, Eaton B,Edles,Tott
page.content: The three villages of Eaton Bray, Edlesborough and Totternhoe lie at the foot of the Dunstable Downs (famous for its gliding and Whipsnade Zoo), some 36 miles north of London, and where the flat and fertile Vale of Aylesbury, meets the northern outreaches of the Chiltern Hills, on the borders of Beds and Bucks. Separated from the industry and commerce of nearby Dunstable and Luton by Chalk hills rising to over 800 feet above sea level, the villages have a pleasant, and largely unspoilt, rural atmosphere with outstanding views in almost every direction. This, coupled with its proximity to the M1 and to two major railway lines at Leighton Buzzard and Luton, has made it a very attractive residential location for the more affluent commuter and local business executive.
